Comment: > The campaign will seek to address Americans' chronic health problems by inspiring them to "take control of their health” and pledge to adopt healthier habits like eating well and exercising, according to the document. The campaign will also create a fitness challenge expanding the Presidents’ Youth Fitness program to adults.  There’s something there that, *in a vacuum*, is a good idea.  If HHS were to launch a large wellness campaign, it’d probably do some good.  But because it’s run by a fucking crockpot who thinks the cure for autism is working in the fields, you have to ask what the catch is.

Comment: What does this even mean?  Forgetting the fact that conservatives flipped their shit when Michelle Obama tried to have the same initiative. My question is in terms of the HHS, what does this mean?  If you want people to take back their health make access to quality healthcare more available. The barrier of entry to have preventative and sick care is still too high and for some insurmountable.  You want good nutrition?   Stop allowing garbage to be introduced to our food supply.   Make nutritious food cheap.  Stop allowing companies to market their garbage to children and teens.  This isn’t rocket science. You can’t take back your health when it’s practically impossible for many. Much of this is economics and psychological manipulation. Fix those issues and people will start living healthier lives.
